content:
https://smarthealthit.org/smart-on-fhir-api talks about FHIR profiles for SMART... have I been missing something obvious, because I haven't seen them?

For example:

SMART specifications are ‘opinionated,’ making up-front choices about how data are represented so that developers know what to expect. For instance, every problem in a SMART record is associated with a SNOMED CT disorder code

Implies there are FHIR Observation/Condition for SMART.
That language predates the creation of FHIR US Core profiles :-) Since then, outside of a few narrow places (e.g., SMART Scheduling Links), SMART generally defers data profiling to HL7.
